summary:
Passionate about people and nature.

Being from Soweto, the social and environmental injustices that have been inherited from the township’s creation are part of my lived-experience. Therefore, I am driven to collaborate with communities towards understanding and resolving spatial, governance  and resource access issues. I believe in the power of research and technical practice to create sustainable, pleasing and inclusive spaces whilst responding to the challenges of urbanisation and climate change.

volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'role': 'Public Space Research Assistant', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Johannesburg City Parks and Zoo', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'The Research and Knowledge Management Department at Johanneburg City Parks and Zoo is leading efforts to establish a Centre on African Public Spaces. Because this Centre is in its start-up phase, my role has been transient. I mainly assist with writing and editing of various essay assignments and different documents such reports, reviews, Terms of Reference, presentations, letters etc. Other responsibilities have included creating a database of key partners, participating in strategic workshops, sending communications to partners and even logo design.

Through my involvement in this initiative, since the beginning of the COVID-19 lockdown, I have attended numerous webinar discussions on Public Space. These were by: World Parks Academy, Placemaking-X, the Academy of Leisure Sciences and Commonwealth Association of Architects.
Thus, I have developed a broader understanding of topics relevant to the Built Environment and an awareness of key players in the Public Space agenda.

This Centre will provide a platform for  sharing knowledge and good practices that reflect the African context. 
It has been extremely fulfilling working on this project.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'role': 'Bikelink Chairperson', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'UCT Green Campus Initiative', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'GCI is THE environmental society at UCT. We create awareness and work on initiatives, relating to:  recycling, water conservation, fossil fuel divestment and sustainability among others. The Bikelink portfolio is about growing a culture of cycling in the UCT community, to improve student well-being as well as to promote sustainable transport. We organize cycling workshops (taught students how to cycle on 20 May 2017).  GCI is currently re-imagining the UCT Jammie Bike Project and we will be relaunching this initiative (which was initiated in 2014). Another goal of the portfolio is to make bicycles available to residences.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'role': 'House-to-house collections', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Ahmed Kathrada Foundation Operation Winter Warm', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'POVERTY_ALLEVIATION', 'description': 'An annual event, involving the collection of donated food, clothing and stationary in the Lenasia area, which is distributed to orphanages and shelters.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'role': 'Food distribution', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Cheerful Givers South Africa', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'CHILDREN', 'description': 'Every year, Cheerful Givers (an NGO established and run by the youth) hosts a Christmas Cupcake Drive, whereby children in the informal settlement of Lolli-extension are gathered and spend an afternoon of fun whip enjoying cupcakes, other snack and gifts of toys.'}]
